title: Experienced Graphic Designer
job_overview:
The Graphic Designer is responsible for creating visual content that communicates ideas, inspires, informs, and captivates audiences. This role requires a strong understanding of design principles, brand identity, and user experience to develop creative assets for both digital and print platforms. The ideal candidate is highly creative, detail-oriented, and capable of managing multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.

Key Responsibilities:

1. Creative Design & Development
Conceptualize and design graphics for various platforms including social media, websites, email campaigns, presentations, advertisements, and print materials.
Translate business and marketing objectives into compelling visual content.
Create consistent brand visuals and templates that align with brand guidelines and tone.

2. Brand Identity Management
Maintain and evolve the company’s visual identity across all media.
Ensure brand consistency in all design outputs, from typography and colors to layout and imagery.
Create and update brand style guides when necessary.

3. Marketing & Advertising Materials
Design marketing creatives and branded visuals such as newsletters, social media graphics, email campaign layouts, website headers, landing pages, internal posters, announcements, and more—ensuring alignment with the company’s brand identity.
Develop digital assets for paid ads (Facebook, Instagram, Google, etc.), landing pages, and newsletters.
Create high-converting product or service visuals across all our social media platforms
Create designs and visual assets for company events, including banners, flyers, digital invites, and presentation decks.
Develop branded materials for internal campaigns, such as newsletters, onboarding kits, and recognition programs in collaboration with the Marketing Manager.
Responsible for delivering the design for the newsletter within a week once a month
Support in creating promotional materials for tradeshows, community outreach, and sponsorships.
Other duties as assigned.

4. Social Media & Web Design
Design engaging content tailored to each platform (Instagram posts/stories, Facebook covers, YouTube thumbnails, etc.).
Work closely with the marketing team to develop content calendars and visual campaigns.
Create web graphics, hero images, icons, and other UI elements in collaboration with the marketing team.

5. Video & Motion Graphics (optional)
Develop engaging video content and creative topic ideas for social media posts, ensuring relevance, brand consistency, and audience appeal across platforms.
Collaborate with the marketing team to align messaging, trends, and campaign goals. Edit short-form videos, reels, or animations to boost online visibility and engagement.
Create (2) 2 to 3 minutes Youtube Videos and (60 seconds) Reels video per week
Assist in editing company videos such us marketing videos and company event videos

6. Collaboration & Communication
Work closely with marketing, product, and content teams to understand project requirements and deliver timely outputs.
Communicate design concepts clearly and accept constructive feedback for revisions.
Participate in brainstorming sessions and contribute creative ideas.
Maintain and update company templates (e.g., PowerPoint, Google Slides, letterheads) to ensure consistency.

7. File Management & Asset Delivery
Prepare final designs for production (web, print, or multimedia) ensuring proper formats, sizes, and resolutions.
Organize and manage files, keeping an efficient library of design resources and assets.
Communicate with Marketing Manager about updates and file management

Skills and Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Graphic Design, Visual Arts, Multimedia, or a related field.
3+ years of proven graphic design experience (freelance or agency experience is a plus).
Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, After Effects), Canva, Figma, or similar tools.
Strong portfolio showcasing a range of creative projects.
Excellent visual, typographic, and color skills with attention to detail.
Understanding of digital marketing concepts and social media trends.
Time management skills and ability to handle multiple projects and deadlines.

MUST HAVES - If you don’t match the following criteria, unfortunately, we are not a match
- Strong Internet Connection
- Back-up Power Source
- Noise Canceling Headset
- Private Office Space without distractions

>>>>Employee Benefits

Opportunities for career growth and advancement
Access to ongoing training, workshops, and professional development programs
Support for continued education and skill-building
Paid time off (PTO) for rest, recovery, and personal time
Holiday pay for recognized national and company holidays
Fixed weekday schedule with weekends off to support work-life balance
Early-out Fridays to kickstart the weekend
Performance-based incentives and bonuses
Team-building activities and virtual/in-person events
Employee recognition programs and yearly awards
Celebrations for birthdays, anniversaries, and milestones
A supportive and collaborative work culture
